sn14.34:4.2: “Mendicants, if the earth element was exclusively painful—soaked and steeped in pain and not steeped in pleasure—sentient beings wouldn’t love it.
sn14.34:4.3: But because the earth element is pleasurable—soaked and steeped in pleasure and not steeped in pain—sentient beings do love it.
sn14.34:6.1: If the earth element was exclusively pleasurable—soaked and steeped in pleasure and not steeped in pain—sentient beings wouldn’t become disillusioned with it.
sn14.34:6.2: But because the earth element is painful—soaked and steeped in pain and not steeped in pleasure—sentient beings do become disillusioned with it.
sn14.34:7.3: If the air element was exclusively pleasurable—soaked and steeped in pleasure and not steeped in pain—sentient beings wouldn’t become disillusioned with it.
sn14.34:7.4: But because the air element is painful—soaked and steeped in pain and not steeped in pleasure—sentient beings do become disillusioned with it.”
